body:
When trying to install py-scipy, I get an error message. Should we make the +shared variant of netlib-lapack enabled by default?

``` bash
$ spack install py-scipy
==> Error: Invalid spec: 'netlib-lapack@3.5.0%gcc@5.3.0~shared=linux-x86_64^cmake@3.4.0%gcc@5.3.0+ncurses=linux-x86_64^ncurses@6.0%gcc@5.3.0=linux-x86_64^netlib-blas@3.5.0%gcc@5.3.0~fpic=linux-x86_64'. Package netlib-lapack requires variant +shared, but spec asked for ~shared
```
title: py-scipy / netlib-lapack spec is too constrained
